Activity: Arrive at the office, check emails. Review the list I made yesterday. Prepare for meeting with @ldes-1.

Meeting with @ldes-1 to discuss overall narrative direction, key themes, and potential player agency. Take detailed notes and ask clarifying questions. Discuss the scope of the main storyline and potential branching paths. Bring my initial lore document and the mood board.

Begin developing the main characters. Start with the protagonist(s), outlining their background, personality, motivations, and potential arc. Consider their strengths, weaknesses, and any internal conflicts they might face.

Continue fleshing out the main characters. Write a short paragraph describing their relationship with the other key characters in the game world. Consider how their past experiences will shape their choices and actions throughout the game. Refine the character descriptions based on the meeting with @ldes-1.

Focus on the antagonist(s). Define their motivations, goals, and methods. Consider their perspective and the reasons behind their actions. Ensure they are compelling and believable, even if morally questionable. Brainstorm potential weaknesses that players can exploit.

Draft short character bios for at least three important NPCs. Consider their roles in the story, their relationships with the main characters, and their unique personalities. Think about their backstories and how they might influence player interactions.

Review the character profiles and identify areas for improvement. Write a short email to @3dmod-1 and @cart-1 outlining the character concepts and requesting visual references for clothing, hairstyles, and facial features.
